channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Jungmin Chang
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Jungmin Chang

item.title: Project 2: Contingency Table and Measure of Association
item.description: The essence of epidemiology is to measure disease occurrence and make comparisons within and between population. Different measures may be used to explain differences in the distribution of disease or other health outcomes of interest between populations. Health outcomes measured in epidemiological studies will vary across studies, for instance, morbidity, mortality, infectious disease incidence, vaccine efficacy etc. In this project, we aim to understand a variety of measures employed in epidemiology and measure occurrences and associations of health outcomes of interest in real world setting using R packages.

item.title: Project 1: Data Manipulation and Visualization
item.description: Data visualization is simply mapping data to geometry and color, which really helps us to understand data. For data visualization project, I used gapminder data from the Gapminder package in r. I encoded values to a variety of visual cues like position, length, shape or color to explore the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita across five continents. Different types of plots were chosen including scatter plots, bar plots and box plots.

item.title: Project 2: New York City Schools Perceptions
item.description: In this project, I not only explored whether students, teachers, and parents have similar perceptions of NYC school quality, but also whether student, teacher, and parent perceptions of NYC school quality appear to be related to demographic and academic success metrics. To do so, I incorporated 2011 NYC School Survey data into demographic and test score data from the New York City Department of Education. My task was 1) to clean fairly large datasets with many variables and confusing metadata, 2) to use correlation analysis to highlight potentially interesting relationships between variables and 3) to explore them in greater depth using plots

item.title: Project 1: Analyzing Forest Fire Data
item.description: Forest fires can create ecological problems and endanger human lives and property. Understanding when they occur and what causes them is important for managing them. The data Iâ€™ve been working with in this guided project is associated with a scientific research paper (Cortez, P., & Morais, A. D. J. R., 2007) on predicting the occurrence of forest fires in Portugal using modeling techniques. In this guided project, my task was to use these techniques, as well as data analysis skills, to explore data on forest fires.
